meanings.definition: Different forms of the same letter or symbol.
meanings.sent1: In calligraphy, artists often experiment with various allographs of the letter 'A'.
meanings.sent2: The font designer created multiple allographs of the number '7' for the new typeface.
meanings.sent3: The typewriter seemed confused, typing out strange allographs of the letter 'B'.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting transformed the allographs of the word 'hello' into a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The ancient manuscript contained intricate allographs of the symbol for 'infinity'.
